title: Is it possible to store emails in both IMAP and local folders?
creator: PineGrove36
content:
I have all of my emails in IMAP folders. When I travel I don't always have internet access. It would be helpful to have access to work-related emails at those times. Two questions:

(1) Is it possible to store emails in both IMAP and local folders so I can access them offline?

(2) Is there some setting that can automatically store all emails in IMAP and local folders?

Thanks for your help!
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:127.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/127.0

title: Thunderbird not connecting to email server(?)
creator: faze62
content: I have been using Thunderbird for decades. I now use a windows 11 PC Recently, it have been taking a very long time to connect to my POP3 email server (am I using the right terminology?)--which is att.net. Then, about a week ago, it stopped connecting entirely. I tried everything, then as a last resort, I saved all my profile data (I know how to do this) on to an external drive, uninstalled Thunderbird from the PC, deleted all the files, both local and roaming, and then downloaded and installed it again, just as if I was a first time user. Still would not connect. I can still receive emails on my ipad, phone, and on yahoo.com on a browser, so I know that my password is correct. Thoughts?

Did this reply solve your problem? user213815874572776100201782415079883066567 user213815874572776100201782415079883066567 12/25/24, 12:53‚ÄØPM

Let's summarize.You're having problems with three accounts. 

   AOL: is working now, but shows no messages received between May and September.    GMX: shows no messages received between May and December. Not clear if it is working now.    Gmail: no longer exists in Thunderbird.

Is that correct?

Were the missing messages in IMAP folders or POP3 folders or local folders or some combination?

Steps to take: 

   AOL: Can you see the missing messages when you log into aol.com? If not, do you have a back-up?    GMX: Is the account working now? Can you see the missing messages when you log into Web mail? If not, do you have a back-up?    Gmail: Can you set up your account again and tell us what you see?

Would you please also tell us what was going on in May and September and December? When did you re-install Thunderbird? Did you re-install Thunderbird more than once? How did you re-install it? Have you been using Thunderbird since May? Have you been accessing the messages through another e-mail client or over the Web? When did you notice that messages were missing?

Did you re-install Thunderbird because your accounts were not working? Re-installing Thunderbird does not help with send and receive issues.

I understand that you would like a quick solution, but this situation is complex. It takes time to gather information and diagnose the problem.

My guess for now is that Thunderbird is working properly. Your messages were deleted at the server or through another e-mail client or by how you re-installed Thunderbird. You will not find the missing messages unless you have them backed up somewhere. But that's just a guess. Let's hope for a better result. Helpful?

content:
Heb een probleem met het mail programma. klik op Thunderbird om mail te starten, echter er opent 3 kolommen, de eerste postvak in en twee waarin alleen staat laden met in beiden een heen en weer schietend balletje. na klikken wordt het vaag en reageert er niets meer, ook mail komt niet binnen. dit is alleen te stoppen door rechtsboven op het kruisje te klikken waarna er enkele mededelingen staat dat bij afsluiten gegevens kunnen verdwijnen en je het kunt sluiten. Helaas bij afsluiten en opnieuw starten komt steeds het zelfde tevoorschijn, uitschakelen en opnieuw opstarten van de PC geeft ook geen resultaat, Thunderbird blijft steeds het zelfde protocol afwerken. heel soms zie ik links dat er wel een aantal mails in staan maar aanklikken heeft geen resultaat, het blijft grijs. Hans Verhaar Enschede. (heb Ziggo en Googlemail)

user213815874572776100201782415079883066567 user213815874572776100201782415079883066567 12/25/24, 12:53‚ÄØPM more options Let's summarize.You're having problems with three accounts.

AOL: is working now, but shows no messages received between May and September. GMX: shows no messages received between May and December. Not clear if it is working now. Gmail: no longer exists in Thunderbird. Is that correct?

Were the missing messages in IMAP folders or POP3 folders or local folders or some combination?

Steps to take:

AOL: Can you see the missing messages when you log into aol.com? If not, do you have a back-up? GMX: Is the account working now? Can you see the missing messages when you log into Web mail? If not, do you have a back-up? Gmail: Can you set up your account again and tell us what you see? Would you please also tell us what was going on in May and September and December? When did you re-install Thunderbird? Did you re-install Thunderbird more than once? How did you re-install it? Have you been using Thunderbird since May? Have you been accessing the messages through another e-mail client or over the Web? When did you notice that messages were missing?

Did you re-install Thunderbird because your accounts were not working? Re-installing Thunderbird does not help with send and receive issues.

I understand that you would like a quick solution, but this situation is complex. It takes time to gather information and diagnose the problem.

My guess for now is that Thunderbird is working properly. Your messages were deleted at the server or through another e-mail client or by how you re-installed Thunderbird. You will not find the missing messages unless you have them backed up somewhere. But that's just a guess. Let's hope for a better result.

title: Error in interpretation of recurring events from Outlook
creator: olguing.v
content:
Hi all! I got to Thunderbird as Microsoft got rid of the Mail & Calendar app which I had been using for quite some time as my calendar on my Windows laptops (both personal and from work). What was really good about it was the capability of connecting my calendars from work (Office) and personal (Google) in the same place on my Windows laptops. Once again, I was really satisfied with the Calendar from the Mail&Calendar app from Windows. The main feature that I really liked was that it had a multi-week view and that I could scroll through the weeks and view the current week on top. Weirdly enough it is not a feature so common in calendar apps. Because of that, I did a little research and Thunderbird had that feature, so I started using it, but unfortunately I run into my main issue (and an additional one): - In my work calendar I have set some recurring events happening on the "last working day of the month" for several months. Unfortunately when I get access to my calendar on Thunderbird (by using the Provider for Exchange ActiveSync and TbSync extensions) I get the event repeated on all the working days of the last week of a month (as in the picture included image, where it should be only on the 31st - case of march 2026), which is pretty annoying. Is there a way to fix that?

As a note, the same happens in my Android phone when I get the calendar information from Outlook in my Google calendar, which is also pretty annoying.

Finally, as an additional issue (which I think is related to Google unfortunately, but I might as well ask), the Birthday calendar (which I have set as extracting the information from Contacts) is getting duplicated in my main calendar when I sync to Thunderbird. Therefore, I get see twice the birthdays: one in the Birthday calendar itself, and other in my main calendar. I would appreciate a fix for that as well.

Thanks in advance for the suggestions. Kind regards, Vicente.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:133.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/133.0

title: LOCAL Folders
creator: esycip8
content:
I use the IMAP protocol for my email structure. This way all my devices (desktop, notebook, cell, etc......) show the same information & in sync with each other. Because we have very limited (500mb) email storage on the server I am not able to keep all my folders and email history on the server. As a work around, on my desktop I have organized my emails in folders and store them in the "Local Folder". While I am in the office and on my desktop, everything seem to work well. Unfortunately, this becomes a problem when I travel or need to work remotely from my notebook. I have no access to the "Local Folder".

I realize one very easy fix to this is to acquire more storage space from our service provider. Unfortunately, this is not a viable solution for us at this time because of the exhorbitant fees from our service provider.

Do you have any recommendation on how I can "bring" the local folder with me when I work remotely from my notebook or from another computer at home?

Thanks in advance.

Eric esycip@jeepneyexpress.net
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:133.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/133.0

title: Thunderbird email time
creator: redroone
content:
I have recently installed Thunderbird and will willingly make a donation if only I can get it to work without obvious problems. I have an outlook address and have set up Thunderbird using IMAP and apart from this issue it now seems to be working well.

I have a problem with the date showing on Sent, received etc screens in that they are all showing 12 hours out. My computer is set to UK regional time.

I have found the question raised by groovechild 2 on 3 September 2021 which deals with this question and the answer given is to find in config editor 'privacy.resistFingerprinting' and set this to 'false'. It is already set to 'false' in my copy of Thunderbird.

I have fiddled around with other 'privacy.resitFingerprinting' items in config editor by setting those to 'false' and have explored within config editor 'timezone' but there is nothing which seems to address this issue.

All I want is to show that I send and receive emails during the day and not during the early morning/night (ie the current UK time less 12 hours)!

Help please.

title: TB saving my sent messages in a new folder
creator: MrYossu
content:
TB 128.5.2esr (64-bit) on Windows 11, using unified layout.

Not sure if I did something last year (and previous years presumably) to set this up, but TB has always archived incoming messages in a folder under the account, in a subfolder whose name is the year. For example, see the attached screenshot.

I was expecting that when Jan 1st came long, TB would do the same, but store them in a 2025 folder. However, it hasn't, and I'm not sure where this year's archived messages are. As you can see, there isn't a 2025 folder. If I click on the main Archives node, I can see the messages, but I'm not sure where they are. If I go to the account settings and look in the "Copies & folders" section, there is an "Archive options..." button. Clicking that pops up a window that has three radio buttons, the selected one being "Yearly archived folders" so I would have expected this to work.

Anyone able to explain how I get it to store archived messages in a 2025 folder under the account in Archives?

Thanks

title: How to sync Thunderbird with iPhone without iCloud
creator: paul.mcgurgan
content: I am considering migrating from Outlook 2016 to Thunderbird, but cannot see how to sync my contact and calendar to my iPhone. I've been using iTunes to sync, but Apple is killing that off so I'll have to move to Apple Devices (?). I've use Outlook since it was initially released, and was always happy with it, but it seems that it's time to move on, and T'bird seems like to most similar alternative. This sync process causes me to hesitate. Suggestions?
